events.description: > On 20 March 1800, Alessandro Volta wrote to the London Royal Society to describe the technique for producing electric current using [a voltaic pile]

> In Newhall Street, John Mitchell pioneered mass production of steel pens
  in 1822; prior to that the quill pen had been the most common form of writing instrument.

> The first alternator to produce alternating current was a dynamo
  electric generator based on Michael Faraday's principles constructed by the French instrument maker Hippolyte Pixii

events.blurb: Metal nib pens now common in the mundane world
events.description: This is an estimate, it occurred in the "mid 1800s."
events.source: Mr. David Kittredge. "[Pens and penmanship: a brief history](https://www.eagletimes.com/lifestyles/pens-and-penmanship-a-brief-history/article_8ffbdc8e-c35b-11e8-acb3-7771f36823b2.html)" [Eagle Times](https://www.eagletimes.com/) 2018-09-29. Last viewed 2021-02-26.

events.description:
> The late 1870s and early 1880s saw electricity starting to be
  generated at power stations.

events.blurb: Decree for the Reasonable Restriction of Underage Sorcery
events.description: Passed at an unknown point this year.

events.blurb: Queen Victoria grants a charter to the NSPCC
events.description:
While it had previously operated under the name "the London 
Society for the Prevention of Creulty to Children", it had by
now become a national organization with branches across Great
Britain and Ireland.

events.blurb: Prevention of Cruelty to, and Protection of, Children Act 1889
events.description:
The first child welfare act in the UK.  The state can now
intervene in problems between parents and children, including
the power to arrest and the authority to enter a home. 
Child employment and begging were also regulated.
